intro: Achymus pallens, commonly known as the pale achymus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster at the top of the stem. Achymus pallens is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in the summer months.
